alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 14 at 9:38AM CST until January 15 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST /MIDNIGHT CST/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...North winds 30 to 45 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. * WHERE...Greeley and Wichita Counties. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST /midnight CST/ this evening. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions are anticipated to be the primary impact, especially on west to east routes such as Interstate 70, where cross winds will be strongest. High profile vehicles will see the worst impacts.
info.instruction: If you are driving, watch for objects blowing across the roadway and into your path. Keep a safe distance from cars in adjacent lanes as strong gusts could suddenly push a vehicle outside its lane of travel. Take extra care in high-profile vehicles such as a truck, van, or SUV, or when towing a trailer, as these are more prone to be pushed or even flipped by high winds.
